title: Star Trek: The Next Generation
fullTitle: Star Trek: The Next Generation (TV Series 1987â€“1994)

episodes.title: Encounter at Farpoint
episodes.plot: On the maiden mission of the U.S.S. Enterprise (NCC-1701-D), an omnipotent being known as Q challenges the crew to discover the secret of a mysterious base in an advanced and civilized fashion.

episodes.title: The Naked Now
episodes.plot: The crew of the Enterprise is infected with a virus that causes them to behave as though they were intoxicated.

episodes.title: Code of Honor
episodes.plot: When the leader of an alien culture takes a romantic interest in Lt. Yar, he claims her for his own, to the dismay of his own wife, who, in turn, challenges Tasha in a fight to the death.

episodes.title: The Last Outpost
episodes.plot: The Enterprise makes a confrontational first contact with the piratical Ferengi race as their two ships are ensnared by a presumed dead planet ready to judge them.

episodes.title: Where No One Has Gone Before
episodes.plot: Everyone accurately pegs a visiting propulsion scientist as a charlatan, but only Wesley Crusher recognizes his alien assistant as the real deal.

episodes.title: Lonely Among Us
episodes.plot: While distracted by two antithetical races applying for Federation membership, the Enterprise picks up a sentient entity that can alternately possess either man or machinery.

episodes.title: Justice
episodes.plot: On an alien planet, young Wesley Crusher commits a transgression - small by our standards but mandatorily punishable by death in theirs.

episodes.title: The Battle
episodes.plot: Beware Ferengi bearing gifts. Capt. Picard receives the Stargazer, a ship considered lost that he once commanded.

episodes.title: Hide And Q
episodes.plot: The Enterprise encounters Q again, and he tempts Riker by endowing him with the powers of the Q.

episodes.title: Haven
episodes.plot: While on a mission to a planet called Haven, Counselor Troi meets her husband to be, a marriage arranged by her father years before, as the Enterprise encounters a ship far deadlier than any combat could provide.

episodes.title: The Big Goodbye
episodes.plot: Captain Picard and some of his crew are caught in a deadly trap in the holodeck as the result of a ship-wide scan from an alien race.

episodes.title: Datalore
episodes.plot: The Enterprise visits the planet where Data was created and discovers another android like him, but when he's assembled, he's not exactly like him.

episodes.title: Angel One
episodes.plot: Riker, Troi, Data and Yar beam down to a planet ruled by a matriarchal government in the hopes of locating a missing freighter crew.
The Enterprise docks at a starbase for repairs where it is commandeered by a race of technologically-linked aliens intent on using the vessel for their own purposes.

episodes.title: Too Short A Season
episodes.plot: The Enterprise transports an elderly Starfleet Admiral to negotiate a hostage crisis. When the Admiral takes a de-aging drug, he endangers both his life and the mission.

episodes.title: When The Bough Breaks
episodes.plot: A planet that was able to cloak itself for thousands of years suddenly reveals itself, with its inhabitants proposing peace. But, after initial negotiations, children of the Enterprise are kidnapped due to the infertility of the inhabitants.

episodes.title: Home Soil
episodes.plot: On Velara III, Geordi and Data discover a microscopic life form responsible for the death of an engineer stationed on the base.

episodes.title: Coming of Age
episodes.plot: Picard finds himself facing a strenuous test of his loyalty to Starfleet, one which the other members of the crew are struggling to cope with, whilst Wesley faces an equally challenging entrance exam at Starfleet Academy.

episodes.title: Heart of Glory
episodes.plot: The Enterprise searches for answers as to why three Klingon warriors were the only survivors aboard a freighter just inside the Neutral Zone which was seemingly attacked by a Ferengi ship.

episodes.title: The Arsenal of Freedom
episodes.plot: The Enterprise encounters a planet long dead, but technical equipment still functions for the purpose of selling off its arsenal, along with self sufficiency.

episodes.title: Symbiosis
episodes.plot: The Enterprise encounters two neighboring cultures, one suffering from a plague, the other marketing a cure, and learns that nothing is as simple as it seems.

episodes.title: Skin Of Evil
episodes.plot: Counselor Troi is held captive on a deserted planet by a slick, black, oily, sentient and immortal puddle of evil.

episodes.title: We'll Always Have Paris
episodes.plot: A scientist's experiment in time goes awry, reuniting Picard with an old flame, now married to the scientist.

episodes.title: Conspiracy
episodes.plot: After diverting to a secret meeting with an old friend and some of Starfleet's finest commanders, Picard finds the Horatio blown to bits just hours after the meeting and he returns the Enterprise to Earth looking for answers.

episodes.title: The Neutral Zone
episodes.plot: While assigned to investigate missing outposts in the Neutral Zone, the Enterprise revives three cryogenically frozen people found aboard a wayward derelict Earth vessel.
